text:
@backend people

can you please verify if this is correct?

*System design*
 
 

*1. System Architecture*
A *three-tier architecture* is chosen for the system:
*Frontend (Presentation Layer)*
●     *Users*: Donors, NGOs, Admins
●     *Technologies*: ReactJS (for dynamic and responsive user interfaces)
●     Features:
○     User registration and login forms
○     Donation forms
○     NGO profiles and listings
○     Admin dashboards
*Backend (Application Layer)*
●     *Technologies*: Python, Django REST Framework
●     Features:
○     API development for CRUD operations
○     Payment processing and integration
○     Feedback and review management
○     Security measures like role-based access control (RBAC)
*Database (Data Layer)*
●     *Technologies*: PostgreSQL (relational database)
●     Features:
○     Data models for users, NGOs, donations, feedback, and reports
○     Secure storage for transaction records
○     Query optimization for search and filtering



*2. Component Diagram*
This design identifies major components and their interactions.
*Major Components:*
1. *User Management Module*
○     Handles CRUD operations for donors, NGOs, and admin users
○     Role-based access control
1. *NGO Verification Module*
○     Document submission, status updates, and verification APIs
1. *Donation Management Module*
○     Payment gateway integration
○     Receipt generation and transaction management
1. *Feedback and Support Module*
○     Allows donors to leave feedback and NGOs to respond
○     Moderation by admins
1. *Reporting Module*
○     Generates reports for NGOs and donations
○     Export options (CSV/PDF)
1. *Admin Dashboard Module*
○     Tools for account and feedback management
○     Auditing and monitoring tools



*3. Data Flow Diagram (DFD)*
*Level 0: Context Diagram*
●     External entities: Donors, NGOs, Admins
●     Central system processes their requests and provides responses.
*Level 1: Expanded View*
1. Donor logs in → Makes donations → Receives receipts
2. NGO registers → Admin verifies → NGO updates profile
3. Admin manages user data → Generates reports


*4. Database Design*
*Tables:*
●     *Users*: Stores user details, roles (Donor, NGO, Admin)
●     *NGOs*: Stores NGO information, documents, and verification status
●     *Donations*: Records transactions, receipts, and donor details
●     *Feedback*: Stores donor feedback and NGO replies
●     *Reports*: Stores generated reports metadata
*Relationships:*
●     *One-to-Many*: A donor can make multiple donations
●     *One-to-One*: Each NGO has one verification status
●     *Many-to-Many*: Donors can give feedback to multiple NGOs



*5. API Design*
*Endpoints:*
1. *User Management*:
○     POST /register (for donors/NGOs)
○     POST /login (JWT authentication)
1. *NGO Management*:
○     GET /ngos (list NGOs with filters)
○     PUT /ngos/{id} (update profile)
1. *Donation Management*:
○     POST /donate (process payments)
○     GET /donations (donor history)
1. *Feedback*:
○     POST /feedback (leave feedback)
○     GET /feedback/{ngo_id} (fetch NGO feedback)
1. *Reporting*:
○     GET /reports (generate and download reports)



*6. Security Measures*
1. *Authentication*:
○     JWT for token-based authentication.
1. *Authorization*:
○     Role-based access control (RBAC).
1. *Data Encryption*:
○     Encrypt sensitive fields like passwords and transaction data.
1. *Input Validation*:
○     Sanitize user inputs to prevent SQL injection and XSS.



*7. Scalability Considerations*
1. *Horizontal Scaling*:
○     Use load balancers for web servers.
1. *Caching*:
○     Use Redis for frequently accessed data like NGO listings.
1. *Database Optimization*:
○     Indexing and sharding for large datasets.
1. *Message Queues*:
○     Use RabbitMQ or Kafka for asynchronous tasks like sending notifications.



*8. User Interfaces*
1. *Donor Portal*:
○     View donation history
○     Provide feedback
1. *NGO Dashboard*:
○     Update profiles
○     Respond to feedback
1. *Admin Dashboard*:
○     Manage users, donations, and feedback



*9. Sequence Diagram (for Major Operations)*
1. *Donor Makes a Donation*:
○     Donor → Payment Gateway → System → Generate Receipt
1. *Admin Verifies NGO*:
○     NGO → Submit Docs → Admin → Approve/Reject
